description: Camera.main property uses FindGameObjectsWithTag() internally and doesn't cache the result.
recommendation: It is advised to cache and use the camera component obtained from Game object instead.
Use WebCamTexture.GetPixels32() instead.

description: WebCamTexture.GetPixels32() allocates managed memory if a suitable array is not provided as a parameter.
recommendation: Ensure that you pass an array of Color32[] to this API method for it to fill out, to avoid creating a new array every time the method is called.

description: Some versions of GeometryUtility.CalculateFrustumPlanes() allocate managed memory.
recommendation: Ensure that you use the CalculateFrustumPlanes(Matrix4x4 worldToProjectionMatrix, Plane[] planes) version of this API method, in order to be able to pass a pre-allocated Array of Planes.
Use Resources.FindObjectsOfTypeNonAlloc() instead.
Use Texture2D.GetRawTextureData() instead. This method returns a NativeArray of pixel data, and so does not allocate managed memory.
Use Texture2D.GetRawTextureData() instead. This method returns a NativeArray of pixel data, and so does not allocate managed memory.
Use Rigidbody.SweepTestNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.RaycastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.CapsuleCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.SphereCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.BoxCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.OverlapCapsuleNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.OverlapSphereNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics.OverlapBoxNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.LinecastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.RaycastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.CircleCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.BoxCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.CapsuleCastNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.GetRayIntersectionNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.OverlapPointNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.OverlapCircleNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.OverlapBoxNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.OverlapAreaNonAlloc() instead.
Use Physics2D.OverlapCapsuleNonAlloc() instead.
Ensure you are using one of the versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInChildren() which accepts a List as a parameter and populates it with the components it finds.
Ensure you are using one of the versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInParent() which accepts a List as a parameter and populates it with the components it finds.

description: Some versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInChildren() allocate managed memory.
recommendation: Ensure you are using one of the versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInChildren() which accepts a List as a parameter and populates it with the components it finds.

description: Some versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInParent() allocate managed memory.
recommendation: Ensure you are using one of the versions of GameObject.GetComponentsInParent() which accepts a List as a parameter and populates it with the components it finds.

description: OnTriggerStay() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many Colliders which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnTriggerStay() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnTriggerStay() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many MonoBehaviours which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnTriggerStay() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnTriggerStay2D() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many Collider2Ds which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnTriggerStay2D() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnTriggerStay2D() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many MonoBehaviours which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnTriggerStay2D() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnCollisionStay() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many Colliders which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnCollisionStay() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnCollisionStay() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many MonoBehaviours which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnCollisionStay() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: OnCollisionStay() methods can detrimentally affect performance if they perform a lot of processing or if there are many RigidBodies which implement this method.
recommendation: Profile CPU performance to look for bottlenecks, examine the contents of all OnCollisionStay() methods, and consider refactoring code to not use them.

description: ImageConversion.LoadImage() defaults to maintaining a CPU-accessible copy of the image. This is a waste of memory if not needed.
recommendation: If a CPU-accessible copy of the texture is not required, ensure that the markNonReadable flag passed into the method is set to true.

description: The Renderer.material property creates a unique copy of the Renderer's material. This breaks draw call batching and results in a higher number of draw calls, impacting rendering performance.
recommendation: If possible, use Renderer.sharedMaterial instead.

description: ComputeBuffer.GetData() stalls the CPU until the GPU has finished accessing the buffer. This can lead to significant CPU performance problems.
recommendation: Avoid reading back from ComputeBuffers if it is at all possible. If it's unavoidable, profile your project carefully and regularly to monitor the performance impact.
Use Texture2D.SetPixels32(), Texture2D.GetRawTextureData(), or Texture2D.Apply() instead.
Use Texture3D.SetPixels32() instead.
Use Texture2DArray.SetPixels32() instead.
Use CubemapArray.SetPixels32() instead.

description: GameObject.SendMessage() is a very slow and CPU-intensive method.
recommendation: Implement a custom system to replace SendMessage - get the components you want to send messages to and call methods directly on them.

description: Component.SendMessage() is a very slow and CPU-intensive method.
recommendation: Implement a custom system to replace SendMessage - get the components you want to send messages to and call methods directly on them.

description: OnGUI() is used by the legacy Immediate Mode GUI (IMGUI), which is extremely CPU-intensive. If a single OnGUI() method is present in a project's code, IMGUI will initialize and consume CPU time.
recommendation: Remove all OnGUI() methods from the project code.
Use AI.NavMeshPath.GetCornersNonAlloc() instead.

description: The property Animator.parameters allocates managed memory.
recommendation: Use Animator.GetParameter() instead.
Use Animations.ParentConstraint.GetTranslationOffset() instead.
Use Animations.ParentConstraint.GetRotationOffset() instead.
Use AnimationCurve.AddKey(), AnimationCurve.MoveKey() or AnimationCurve.RemoveKey() instead.
Use Camera.GetAllCameras() instead.
Use Mesh.GetAllBoneWeights() instead. This method returns a NativeArray of BoneWeight1, and so does not allocate managed memory.
Use Mesh.GetBindposes() instead.
Use Mesh.GetVertices() instead.
Use Mesh.GetNormals() instead.
Use Mesh.GetTangents() instead.
Use Mesh.GetUVs() instead.

Use Mesh.GetColors() instead.
Use Mesh.GetColors() instead.
Use Mesh.GetTriangles() instead.
Use Renderer.GetMaterials() instead.
Use Renderer.GetSharedMaterials() instead.
Use Input.GetTouch() instead.
Use Input.GetAccelerationEvent() instead.
Use iOS.NotificationServices.GetLocalNotification() instead.
Use iOS.NotificationServices.GetRemoteNotification() instead.
Use GUISkin.GetStyle() or GUISkin.FindStyle() instead.
Use Collision.GetContacts() instead.
Use Collision2D.GetContacts() instead.
Use TerrainData.GetTreeInstance() instead.
Use TerrainData.GetAlphamapTexture() instead.
Use Font.GetCharacterInfo() instead.

Try to avoid getting this property in frequently-updated code. Prefer using GameObject.CompareTag() instead, as this does not result in managed allocations.

description: Creating Objects at runtime by calling Object.Instantiate can take a significant amount of CPU time and allocates managed memory.
recommendation: Try to avoid calling Object.Instantiate in frequently-updated code. Consider implementing an Object Pool. The ObjectPool class is available from Unity 2021.1 as a convenience.

description: Adding components to GameObjects at runtime can take a significant amount of CPU time and allocates managed memory.
recommendation: Try to avoid adding or removing components in frequently-updated code. Prefer instantiating GameObjects from Prefabs will all the necessary components instead.

description: WarmupAllShaders does not work properly on Metal, Vulkan or DX12. This might result in unexpected CPU spikes due to shader compilation.
recommendation: Implement a shader pre-warming mechanism which renders a small triangle for each combination of vertex format and shader used at runtime. One way to achieve this is with the UnityEngine.Experimental.Rendering.ShaderWarmup API.

description: WarmUp does not work properly on Metal, Vulkan or DX12. This might result in unexpected CPU spikes due to shader compilation.
recommendation: Implement a shader pre-warming mechanism which renders a small triangle for each combination of vertex format and shader variant used at runtime. One way to achieve this is with the UnityEngine.Experimental.Rendering.ShaderWarmup API.
Try to avoid getting this property in frequently-updated code. Prefer using CompareTag() instead, as this does not result in managed allocations.
Try to avoid getting this property in frequently-updated code. Ideally, this property should only be used during initialisation, and the results should be cached if they need to be re-used.

description: Linq allocates large amounts of managed memory and exhibits poor CPU performance.
recommendation: We strongly advise against using Linq in any frequently-updated code. Ban its usage from the project entirely, or confine it to initialization code and use it sparingly.

description: Reflection is slow, and not generally considered performant enough for runtime code.
recommendation: Remove code which relies on reflection, or minimise its usage, particularly outside of initialization.

description: String concatenation operations allocates managed memory.
recommendation: Try to avoid concatenating strings in frequently-updated code. Prefer using a StringBuilder instead, as this minimizes managed allocations.

description: System.DateTime.Now can take a lot of CPU time because it needs to figure out the current timezone and daylight saving time information.
recommendation: Try to avoid using this method in frequently-updated code. Prefer UnityEngine.Time.time or, if precise time is needed, use DateTime.UtcNow.

description: System.AppDomain.GetAssemblies can take a lot of CPU time.
recommendation: Try to minimize calls to System.AppDomain.GetAssemblies by caching the returned assemblies. When possible, use UnityEditor.TypeCache for fast access to types, methods and fields.

description: UnityEditor.AssetDatabase.FindAssets is a CPU-intensive operation and can slow down the Editor for long periods of time on large projects.
recommendation: Try to minimize calls to UnityEditor.AssetDatabase.FindAssets.

description: Object.FindObjectOfType() allocates managed memory and can be slow.
recommendation: Try to avoid calling this method in frequently-updated code. Ideally, this method should only be used during initialisation, and the results should be cached if they need to be re-used.
